term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - bisecting conformation (eclipsing conformation)
term.title: bisecting conformation

item.text: For a structure containing the grouping R3C–C(Y)=X (with identical or different groups R ) the conformation in which the torsion angle is such that X is antiperiplanar to one of the groups R , and, in a Newman projection, the double bond C=X bisects one of the R–C–R angles. In this conformation the bond C–Yeclipses one of the C–R bonds. The other conformation, in which X is synperiplanar to one of the groups R , is called an eclipsing conformation. [image: Not defined]
